thread.title: Steven Gerrard's incredible reaction to Liverpool's equaliser against Chelsea proves he LOVES the club
thread.title_full: Steven Gerrard's incredible reaction to Liverpool's equaliser against Chelsea proves he LOVES the club

author: Jake Polden
title: Steven Gerrard's incredible reaction to Liverpool's equaliser against Chelsea proves he LOVES the club
text:
Sport Steven Gerrard's incredible reaction to Liverpool's equaliser against Chelsea proves he LOVES the club The Reds legend celebrated the goal as if he had himself scored it down on the Anfield pitch Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now An excited Steven Gerrard goes nuts over Liverpool equaliser Share this video Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
If you were wondering how much Liverpool means to Steven Gerrard watch the above video. 
The BT Sport clip captures the Reds legend's reaction to Georginio Wijnaldum's equaliser in their Premier League clash with Chelsea. 
Gerrard, who was watching the game live from Anfield, was very disappointed with the decision to award a free-kick in the first half, leading to a Blues goal. 
He made his voice heard at half time and looked on with baited breath as Liverpool attempted to get back into the game after the break. Steven Gerrard punches the air as Liverpool equalise (Photo: BT Sport) Just in case you couldn't hear the Reds legend celebrating (Photo: BT Sport) 
And much to Gerrard's delight, his prayers were answered on the 57th minute when the Dutch midfielder found the back of the net. 
The above video shows the 36-year-old leaping into the air as if he himself has scored the goal down on the pitch he graced so many times in his career. 
He punches the sky and not doubt shouts the box down before slapping the glass passionately. Wijnaldum celebrates scoring the equaliser for Liverpool (Photo: REUTERS) 
Gerrard, who recently took an academy coaching role at his boyhood club, is widely considered to be Mr Liverpool and this footage should explain exactly why. 
* BT Sport is your home of unmissable live football from the Premier League, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League and FA Cup. Visit btsport.com for more info. poll loading Will Steven Gerrard be a successful youth coach for Liverpool? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
